summary: PHP 8.2 deprecated the ${var} string interpolation syntax in favor of {$var}. The Temporal PHP SDK uses the deprecated syntax, causing deprecation errors when running workflows on PHP 8.2.
userImpact: Workflows fail with deprecation errors on PHP 8.2 due to incompatible string interpolation syntax in the SDK.
rootCause: Temporal PHP SDK uses deprecated ${var} string interpolation syntax which was removed in PHP 8.2; replacement syntax {$var} should be used instead.
proposedFix: Replace all instances of ${var} string interpolation with {$var} syntax throughout the codebase.
resolutionDetails: The SDK was updated to use the modern {$var} string interpolation syntax compatible with PHP 8.2.
keyQuote: Using ${var} in strings is deprecated, use {$var} instead in /project/vendor/temporal/sdk/src/Activity/ActivityCancellationType.php:66
